page.title: 12Interview: a local resident
page.content: Mr. Cyril Williams Mr. Willams lived at Home Farm Filleigh when young. At school he played marbles and hoops in the playground. There were about 40 children in the class. In class they mainly did reading, sums and writing. There were no meals at school. The country children brought their own food and ate it outside in the porch. He recalls "I was lucky to get good food. Some children had very little. Their clothes were very drab by todays standards - stiff shirts, collars and dark suits. There wasn't much fun at school. We had to work hard doing our work on slates and slate pencils and had writing books when we reached the higher standards. I was rude to the teacher and I had two stripes with the cane. I think you will find this in the record book.
